title: Allow changes to stack size via the ulimit command
body: The stack size on WSL is currently static. It would be great to have the flexibility to change it in bash using the ulimit command.

comments.body: I would immensely appreciate running a higher stack size as it's causing some bad limitations in our use-cases.
Will this be fixed with WSL2 being a full (lightweight) VM?
Just adding to this request - absolutely required when running larger programs!
Is it any progress with that?  Would be nice to have ulimit -s unlimited
I can't install LAPACK.... PLS FIX THE ULIMIT COMMAND :'(((

Hitting this issue as I try to do ML work using tmux, fish shell and pytorch. Not sure if I'm doing anything else wrong but most resources I've found suggest increasing the stack size as a first step of debugging.

Adding another vote -- please consider allowing the stack size limit to be upped!
